SENT.plain: Truncal ataxia in medullary infarction may be caused by involvement of the lateral part of the medulla; however, truncal ataxia in infarction involving the inferior olivary nucleus (ION) has received comparatively little attention
We report a patient with truncal ataxia due to medial medullary infarction located in the ION
A lesion in the ION could produce a contralateral truncal ataxia due to increased inhibitoryÂ input to the contralesional vestibular nucleus from the contralesional flocculus
